Meet your instructor Dan Gustafsson FAQs Are there prerequisites? There are no prerequisites for the first course.
 How often do the courses run? Continuously, at your own pace.

summary: An example of using Wowchemy's Book layout for publishing online courses.
title: ðŸ“Š Learn Data Science

content:
Build a foundation in Python.
  1-2 hours per week, for 8 weeks
Learn   Quiz What is the difference between lists and tuples? Lists
 Lists are mutable - they can be changed Slower than tuples Syntax: a_list = [1, 2.0, 'Hello world']  Tuples
 Tuples are immutable - they can’t be changed Tuples are faster than lists Syntax: a_tuple = (1, 2.0, 'Hello world')   Is Python case-sensitive? Yes
title: Python basics

content:
Learn how to visualize data with Plotly.
  1-2 hours per week, for 8 weeks
Learn   Quiz When is a heatmap useful? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
 Write Plotly code to render a bar chart import plotly.express as px data_canada = px.data.gapminder().query("country == 'Canada'") fig = px.bar(data_canada, x='year', y='pop') fig.show()
summary: Learn how to visualize data with Plotly.
title: Visualization

content:
Introduction to statistics for data science.
  1-2 hours per week, for 8 weeks
Learn The general form of the normal probability density function is:
$$ f(x) = \frac{1}{\sigma \sqrt{2\pi} } e^{-\frac{1}{2}\left(\frac{x-\mu}{\sigma}\right)^2} $$
 The parameter $\mu$ is the mean or expectation of the distribution. $\sigma$ is its standard deviation. The variance of the distribution is $\sigma^{2}$.   Quiz What is the parameter $\mu$? The parameter $\mu$ is the mean or expectation of the distribution.
summary: Introduction to statistics for data science.
title: Statistics

content:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.   Slides can be added in a few ways:
 Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.  Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.
summary: An example talk using Wowchemy's Markdown slides feature.
title: Example Talk

content:
Learning is a hands-on business Once in a while I binge-watch youtube. Lately, it’s been Adam Savage and his builds. There is something soothing about watching active creation. I love tinkering and building, but not on his level (of obsession). I guess as a data-guy, the inner workings of the world is what drives me. Empiricist. And creating stuff with your hands is a part of that “hands-on” experience - I consider programming to be in that league.
I’ve been listening to a lot of books lately, and has been amazed at how much things makes sense at the moment, and a week later it’s *poof* … leaving just a wage notion of concepts, like waking up from a beautiful dream. A pop-lecture on youtube today 1 reminded me about what I have come to appreciate more and more with age: After you learn it, you have to make it your own, by actually outputing it back again.
Ways of actually learning The basic ways of actually learning something :
 reflect implement and use share with others  Doing more moocs and linkedin learning and what-not helps naught : I simply haven’t put in the time to reflect, implement and talk about it. All those hours have more or less been lost on me. That’s a hard lesson, right there.
Love matters. As does money. It all boils down to a simple formula for happy-as-a-clam-at-high-tide :
flowchart LR; A((market demand)); B((relevant skills)); C((love doing it)); A <--> C; B <--> C; A <--> B;  This models me as a carrot-driven (“love doing it”) knowledge worker (“relevant skills”) chasing the money (“market demand”). Not entirely untrue. However, at home with small kids, reading and listening (input) is easier, but without space to write or create (output). At work, output is mush easier to defend and input is not considered working2. Also: finding the right project at work that balances development of self, business value and client satisfaction is mostly an impossible triage.
The Savage lesson Unfortunately, time doesn’t wait, so this means a more deliberate, thorough, exercise when-ever I do learn something new. Reflect. Implement. Share. I wish this would have been imparted into my younger self, who lusted more for new sights than for mastery and power. I think that the lesson from Adam Savage is to finish the build, and reflect and share honestly with others.
  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVO8Wt_PCgE&t=943s ↩︎
 Manager: “What if we pay them to upskill, and they leave afterwards?” HR: “What if we don’t, and they stay?” ↩︎
summary: Learning is a hands-on business Once in a while I binge-watch youtube. Lately, it’s been Adam Savage and his builds. There is something soothing about watching active creation. I love tinkering and building, but not on his level (of obsession).
title: Output is the new black

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy Wowchemy | Documentation
 Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides   Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E   Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")   Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
 Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
 A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears   Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view    Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links    night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links   Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}   Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }   Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Wowchemy's Slides feature.
title: Slides
